Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; POLISHED; PAINTED
Name: Pitcher
Description: Small-mouthed pitcher with a moulded straight lip, narrow neck, cylindrical body and base with ring-shaped foot. It has a ribbon handle with two central grooves, which begins at the neck and ends at the upper part of the body. Paste of an orangey colour. Exterior surface with reddish coating, partially polished. The upper area of the body presents a painted decoration of more or less regular circles in a very dark red colour.
